title: Climate change makes wildfires in California more explosive
description: A new study pins about 25% of the extra risk on human-caused climate change.

title: Millions of additional salaried workers could get overtime pay under Biden proposal
description: A proposal from the Labor Department would make an estimated 3.6 million salaried workers newly eligible for overtime pay. It covers workers earning less than $55,000 per year.

title: Former cardinal McCarrick found not competent to stand trial for sex abuse
description: Theodore McCarrick is the most prominent Catholic leader in the U.S. to face sex abuse charges.

title: An AI quadcopter has beaten human champions at drone racing
description: The achievement marks the first time an artificial intelligence system has been able to regularly beat humans in a real-world competition and could lead to better drones in the future.

title: U.S. says Russia has made 'shameful' moves toward new North Korea arms deals
description: According to new U.S. intelligence, the potential agreement would allow North Korea to ship "significant quantities and multiple types" of weapons to Russia for deployment in Ukraine.

title: Photos: See the aftermath of Hurricane Idalia
description: The hurricane was downgraded to a category 3 tropical storm before making landfall in Florida Wednesday. But storm surge has those residents worried as they watch the waters rise.

title: Whatever happened to fly-in medical missions that got kayoed by the pandemic?
description: The COVID emergency brought widespread cancellations for short-term fly-ins to run clinics. Are the missions — praised for the help they provide and criticized for a colonialist mindset — coming back?

title: Mitch McConnell appears to freeze again while talking to reporters in Kentucky
description: Sen. Mitch McConnell appeared to freeze momentarily at an event in Covington, Ky. McConnell also froze in July at a news conference on Capitol Hill, going silent before being escorted away.

title: Rudy Giuliani is liable for defaming 2 Georgia election workers, a judge says
description: Judge Beryl Howell's decision means that a trial will commence in this case to decide how much Rudy Giuliani must pay Ruby Freeman and Wandrea "Shaye" Moss.

title: Kirkus Prize names Jesmyn Ward, Héctor Tobar among finalists for top literary award
description: Finalists for a leading annual literary award were announced Wednesday. The Kirkus Prize awards $50,000 to writers working in the categories of Fiction, Nonfiction, and Young Readers' Literature.

title: He was hailed as a crusader for love. Now he's accused of being a villain
description: Sanjoy Sachdev was lauded as India's cupid. But Sachdev and his group have became villains in the eyes of many of the people they promised to help.

title: Should you stand or sit at a concert? Adele fan ignites debate
description: When security told Juan Lastra to sit down, Adele told them to leave him alone. The incident sparked a debate about concert etiquette. Stand when others are sitting? Tell a fan to sit down?

title: Hollywood union health insurance is particularly good. And it's jeopardized by strike
description: Hollywood actors and writers who qualify for their union health plans get a very good deal compared to other Americans. But not working during the strike threatens their eligibility in the system.

title: Up First briefing: Hurricane Idalia; Proud Boys; Spanish Soccer controversy
description: Florida braces for Hurricane Idalia's landfall. The ex-leader of the Proud Boys will be sentenced today. An unwanted World Cup kiss sparks controversy in Spain.

title: A sesame allergy law has made it harder to avoid the seed. Here's why
description: Sesame is now the 9th official allergen. The FDA designation was supposed to protect people with sesame allergies. Instead, it's become harder to avoid, as more bakers add sesame to their products.

title: An Alaska district aligns its school year with traditional subsistence harvests
description: Three Alaska Native Villages have changed their school calendar so that students now can take part in things like the fall moose hunt and the spring migratory bird harvest.

title: Yes, people often forget to cancel their monthly subscriptions — and the costs add up
description: From streaming TV to razor blades by mail, Americans are buying more goods and services through pay-by-the-month plans. New research shows they often keep paying long after they want to.

title: As more teens overdose on fentanyl, schools face a drug crisis unlike any other
description: Fentanyl-related teen overdose deaths nearly tripled from 2019 to 2021. As the school year gets under way, families in mourning urge education leaders to respond.

title: When life gets hard, you don't have to do it alone. Just ask Lynn
description: A stranger at the beach helped Lynn Fainsilber Katz, and left her feeling like she could continue the life she wants to have.

title: These young Republicans want the GOP to do more to recruit young voters
description: Younger voters favor Democrats by a wide margin, but the Republican Party is trying to change that with the RNC's new youth advisory council and other efforts to reach young voters where they are.

title: Ex-Proud Boys leader Enrique Tarrio to be sentenced today in Jan. 6 case
description: Prosecutors are seeking 33 years for Tarrio. Also set to be sentenced later this week are Tarrio's codefendants: Ethan Nordean, Joseph Biggs, Zachary Rehl and Dominic Pezzola.

title: On Maui, a desperate plea to tourists: please return
description: When the deadly wildfires ignited on Maui, tourists were turned away. Three weeks later, business owners are eager for them visit — responsibly.

title: More than 6 months after Turkey's quake, people who lost homes still await new ones
description: The Feb. 6 earthquake and its aftershocks left nearly 3 million displaced and in need of shelter. In the hard-hit city of Adiyaman, families wait for promises of new homes to be fulfilled.

title: Military officers in Gabon say they have seized power
description: A dozen uniformed soldiers appeared on state television and a spokesman said they intended to "dissolve all institutions of the republic."

title: Idalia strengthens and is now predicted to hit Florida as a Category 4 hurricane
description: The National Hurricane Center said Idalia is now forecasted to be at Category 4 strength at landfall on Florida's Gulf Coast on Wednesday, with winds that could reach at least 130 mph.

title: The EPA removes federal protections for most of the country's wetlands
description: The amended EPA rule is to comply with a Supreme Court ruling this year that narrowed the scope of the Clean Water Act and the agency's power to regulate waterways and wetlands.
